intro: Irlbachia breviflora, commonly known as the short-flowered irlbachia, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It is characterized by its small, clustered flowers that typically bloom in shades of yellow or orange. The plant has narrow, grass-like leaves and is often found in rocky or sandy soils. It thrives in full sun and is adapted to arid environments. Due to its unique appearance and habitat, it is of interest to botanists and conservationists.
